ab.foreign: Née à Hyccara en Sicile vers l'an 429. Conduite en Grèce durant l'expédition des Athéniens à Syracuse,

note.ab:
Lais, the famous Theban greek courtizan, stands on record for requiring no less than ten thou-
sand crowns for a single night.-. Rus's Cyclop. Courtizan

ab.foreign: Chrisippus t Architect has written a work on t Palace of Scaurus.-
What is called t Soldiers's Quarters at Pompej, was t Forum Nundinarium, or market-place.

A relief on one ot tombs represents a most beautiful allegory: (at Pompej)
A vessel has finished her voyage; t passenger seated in t stern relinquishes t helm; t atten-
dant genii are bussied in going aloft to furl t sail; & t soul, as a bird at t mast-head, expands her
wings to fly away;- t voyage of life is ended.-

note.ab:
Osiris. Die erzeugende u wirkende Kraft der Natur. - Stehend mit dem Gliede in den Händen
cf. Caylus rec. T. III. Tab. 2; 1, & Tab VI. Tab. 2, 1. - Heyne Vorlesung. - Pan = Ammon Generator.

ab.foreign: The unfinished bust of Brutus (cf Matthews's Diary) at Florence by M. Angelo is inscribed

"Dum Bruti efficiem Sculptor de marmore ducit,
In mentem sceleris venit, et abstinuit".

As Brutus' form the sculptors' fancy plann'd,
He recollects the crime, & checks his hand.

The late Lord Sandwich on reading these lines, & mistaking it for the Bust of Marcus Brutus, immediately
wrote the following verses.

"Brutum effecisset sculptor, sed mente recursat
Tanti viri virtus, sistit et abstinuit":

Though Brutus' form the Sculptor's art began,
He stopp'd - nor could achieve the godlike man."

richt u Selbstgebrauch. Heidelberg, Oswald.
